actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation Subcommittee on Communications. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 106-1120.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

official_title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to authorize low-power television stations to provide digital data services to subscribers.

summary.text: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to authorize a low-power television (TV) station to utilize its authorized spectrum to provide digital data services to the public by subscription. Requires prior notification to the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) of such intent. Prohibits the FCC from authorizing any new service, station, or modification that would displace or interfere with a low-power station providing such services. Directs the FCC to prevent interference with TV signal reception from low-power stations providing such services.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to authorize low-power television stations to provide digital data services to subscribers.
